intro: Mespilus monogyna var. elegans, commonly known as the Persian white mulberry, is a variant of the white mulberry tree native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters, featuring smooth, gray bark and lance-shaped leaves with a pale underside. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, which are followed by edible, white, fleshy fruits resembling small cherries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical significance in traditional medicine.
